result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Germaine Kareem Heard

defendant.name: Heard, Germaine Kareem
defendant.address: 7060 North Presidio Street Apt J, Milwaukee, WI 53223

records.addlTxt: All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant Germaine Kareem Heard in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court for Germaine Kareem Heard.  Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Bail motion by Defense argued and granted by the Court.  Defense requests a scheduling conference date as he needs time for investigation.  Court grants request.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Motion to Modify Bail Condition received and filed.  bm

Defendant Germaine Kareem Heard appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court in person for Germaine Kareem Heard.  Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #03CF2039. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Gretenhardt. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.
Bail Bond Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Appointing Investigator signed and filed.  bm

2:32 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel, the court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense.  Court appoints Attorney Robert Webb at the rate of $110.00 per hour.  Defendant is not required to repay Milwaukee County.  Order signed and filed this date.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  bm

Defendant Germaine Kareem Heard not in court, in custody. Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for State V.  Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with RLB.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, bail to revert to $500,000.00 .  If alternative Cash Bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.  Monitoring is with 24 hour curfew with exception for verified medical appointments.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with breathalyzer tests.
  Court ordered random drug testing.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Germaine Kareem Heard in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Germaine Kareem Heard in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 12.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
